availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Pennsylvania
City and County of Philadelphia } ss

I, Theodore D. Rand residing in the City of Philadelphia, in the State of Pennsylvania appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a commissioner in and for the State of Pennsylvania to take the acknowledgment of Deeds and other instruments of writing to be used or recorded in the said State of Kentucky and to administer oaths, and affirmations, and to take and certify depositions to be used in the said State of Kentucky, pursuant to the act of the Legislature thereof entitled "Statute of Kentucky authorizing the appointment of commissioners of Deeds in other States" which took effect on the first of July 1852, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of such comissioner, under and by virtue of the Laws of the said State of Kentucky.

Sworn to and Subscribed
before me
Witness my hand & Official Seal this Seventh day of March A.D 1861

Hugh W. Tener
commissioner of Kentucky
for Pennsylvania --

figure.ab:
HUGH W. TENER
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS.
PHILADELPHIA
PENNA.

body.p:
Pennsylvania
Oath
Thos. D Rand
Comr of Deeds
Filed Mar 11. 1861
